item.title: Student Blogs: My perspective on university mental health services

Student Blogs: My perspective on university mental health services

A student's perspective on mental health services at university

item.title: No title
item.description:
Continuing our focus on student mental health, here are some great words of wisdom from a @YoungMindsUK activist this #CharityTuesday

item.title: Who does what when a student dies? | Wonkhe | Comment
item.description:
Who does what when a student dies? | Wonkhe | Comment

A thoughtful piece of what happens when a student dies.

item.title: Opinion: Time to abandon 'resilience' as a concept?
item.description:
Opinion: Time to abandon 'resilience' as a concept?

In this piece Neil Mackenzie, Head of Advice & Representation at Sheffield Students'​ Union, argues that the automatic acceptance of 'resilience' as an agenda may work against students' interests in the long term. Over the past few years we've all heard an emergent narrative about 'Snowflakes'.

item.title: It's hard to articulate grief after a suicide - but we still need support
item.description:
It's hard to articulate grief after a suicide - but we still need support

All staff should have opportunities to disclose personal concerns to a mentor or someone who isn’t responsible for managing their performance.

,

Support is important not only for our students but also our colleagues!

,

JD

item.title: No title
item.description: TransEdu you're "not expected to be expert but at least try" when supporting trans people. Don't just ignore it

item.title: Help seems to be the hardest word
item.description:
Help seems to be the hardest word

,,

Over my career I have probably sat down with hundreds of students offering support and guidance whilst at uni.
Often they get to me because they’ve struggled on, never really asking for help and now it’s just gotten too much.

item.title: #Wellbeing: A Snapshot of the Most Effective and Engaging Online Health and Wellbeing Campaigns
item.description:
#Wellbeing: A Snapshot of the Most Effective and Engaging Online Health and Wellbeing Campaigns

"Having worked over a decade in student affairs, I continue to be amazed and delighted with the quality and variety of educational health and wellbeing resources available online - not only for staff, such as myself, wanting to raise awareness, but also for those students self-motivated to do their own research or seeking support."

item.title: Ten top tips for breaking bad news
item.description:
Ten top tips for breaking bad news

Although aimed at supporting those with end of life care, these tips can be useful for anyone breaking bad news.

item.title: Is empathy enough ?
item.description:
Is empathy enough ?

,,

Over the past year I have embarked on masters in researching higher education and now it comes to the time to think about what my final project will be.
